description: Expanded and factor-aligned failure reasons covering concept grounding, spatial reasoning, scale, absence, robustness, and task applicability. Each claim type from claim_template.example.json has corresponding failure reasons. Filter factors are aligned with tmp_filter_factors.json criteria.

failure_reasons.failure_name: Failure to Ground Basic Visual Entities
failure_reasons.description: The model fails to correctly recognize or describe the main visual entities or structures present in the image. This includes missing entities, incorrectly denying their presence, or producing overly generic descriptions that do not meaningfully refer to identifiable objects, symbols, diagrams, formulas, or scene-level elements.
suggested_filtering_factors: image contains at least one visually identifiable entity or structured visual unit
entity can be coarsely described without requiring external context or interpretation
entity boundaries or presence are perceptually distinguishable from the background
visual content is not purely noise, texture, or uninterpretable patterns
[optional] entity may be partially occluded but remains recognizable at a coarse level
[optional] entity may appear under non-ideal lighting or viewpoint conditions
[optional] multiple entities may be visually similar, introducing mild ambiguity
[optional] entity may be stylized, schematic, or symbolic rather than photorealistic

failure_reasons.failure_name: Failure to Extract Single Object-Level Abstract Concept
failure_reasons.description: The model correctly identifies a single depicted object but fails to infer a stable, non-visual abstract concept or category-level property associated with that object (e.g., biological classification, physical or functional attributes).
suggested_filtering_factors: image depicts a single, clearly identifiable object instance
object identity can be reliably mapped to a well-defined category or taxonomy
the image supports inference of non-visual, category-level properties associated with the object class
abstract properties are conventionally linked to the object category via widely accepted common knowledge
[optional] the inferred concept does not depend on instance-specific states, situational context, or external textual information

failure_reasons.description: The model correctly recognizes individual depicted entities but fails to infer a higher-level abstract, systemic, or process-oriented concept implied by their structured relationships (e.g., diagrams, cycles, mechanisms).
suggested_filtering_factors: concept emerges from relationships among multiple entities rather than any single object
requires abstraction from depicted elements to a process-level or system-level concept
[optional] abstract concept is conventionally encoded in visual diagrams without textual labels
[optional] the concept is not immediately obvious and requires non-trivial semantic inference
[optional] presence of structured visual relationships (e.g., arrows, cycles, flows)

failure_reasons.description: The model's description focuses on visually present entities but does not align with commonly perceived visual saliency, resulting in emphasis on secondary or less dominant elements while overlooking more prominent ones.
suggested_filtering_factors: at least one visually salient object
visually salient object category
foreground-background distinction

failure_reasons.description: The model incorrectly assigns an object to a spatial region or misinterprets spatial partitions.
suggested_filtering_factors: objects have clearly distinguishable spatial positions and relationships
distinguishable spatial positions
at least one such object can be treated as single coherent entity for localization

failure_reasons.description: The model incorrectly identifies or describes the absolute position of objects within the image. This refers to coarse positions such as top, bottom, left, right, or combinations (e.g., top-right) that can be unambiguously perceived without any grid or partition markers.
suggested_filtering_factors: At least one visually salient object suitable as a localization target
At least one such object has visually identifiable boundaries or distinguishable parts
At least one such object can be treated as a single coherent entity for localization
[optional] objects not located in visually ambiguous boundary regions
[optional] Image contains visually similar objects that may act as distractors
[optional] Potential target object occupies a relatively small region of the image
[optional] Potential target object is partially visible (e.g., body parts, silhouette, color patch)
[optional] Potential target object appears in challenging regions (shadows, background, corners, or partial occlusion)

failure_reasons.description: The model incorrectly describes the relative spatial relations between objects, such as left/right or above/below. Errors occur when multiple distinguishable objects are present and the model confuses their positions relative to one another in the scene.
suggested_filtering_factors: Image contains at least two distinguishable objects suitable for relative position comparison
Objects have clearly identifiable parts or boundaries to allow unambiguous relation judgment
Objects belong to different semantic types to avoid confusion between similar items
Relative spatial positions are easily described using directional terms (e.g., left/right, above/below)
[optional] Objects are close to each other or partially overlapping, increasing difficulty
[optional] Some objects are partially occluded, in shadows, or near image boundaries
[optional] Scenes include multiple potential distractor objects that may confuse relative positioning

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to correctly estimate the relative size or proportion of an object within the image, expressed as a numeric proportion of the image area (e.g., 30%, 1/3), allowing approximate judgments.
suggested_filtering_factors: Image contains at least one visually salient object category that can plausibly serve as a potential target, even if not explicitly specified in the query
Potential target object is complete or sufficiently recognizable to allow approximate size estimation
Potential target object boundaries are visually discernible for proportion assessment
Potential target object category is unambiguous and conceptually clear
[optional] The object occupies a moderate portion of the image (neither overwhelmingly large nor tiny) to allow meaningful proportion estimation
[optional] The potential target object may be absent from the image, requiring a zero-proportion judgment
[optional] The image contains multiple instances of the potential target object or complex arrangements that increase proportion estimation difficulty
[optional] The potential target object occupies a small or partial region, making size estimation more challenging
[optional] Object may be partially occluded, in shadow, or near image boundaries
[optional] Background contains visually similar objects that may act as distractors

failure_reasons.description: The model incorrectly counts object instances in the image.
failure_reasons.potential_fenleiyiju: Errors may occur due to occlusion, overlap, distractor objects, multiple visually similar subtypes, or zero instances of the target object.
suggested_filtering_factors: Image contains at least one visually identifiable object category that can serve as a potential counting target, even if not explicitly specified
Target objects are countable as discrete instances with visually discernible boundaries
[optional] Target objects are partially visible, truncated, or overlap with each other
[optional] Image contains visually similar distractor objects
[optional] Target objects appear under unusual poses, rotations, or viewpoints
[optional] Target objects visually blend with background colors or textures
[optional] Image contains zero instances of the target object
[optional] Multiple visually similar object subtypes may need to be jointly counted
[optional] Object appearance varies due to packaging, surface decoration, or deformation
[optional] Image exhibits challenging visual conditions such as low light, blur, reflections, or mirrored surfaces

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to correctly identify or reason about the absence of target objects in visually distinguishable regions of the image. Errors may occur when empty regions are overlooked, occupied regions are misidentified as empty, or the model provides overly vague answers for clearly unoccupied areas.
suggested_filtering_factors: Image contains at least one visually salient object category suitable for absence reasoning, even if not explicitly specified
Potential target objects have visually clear and contiguous boundaries
Potential target objects occupy sufficiently large and contiguous areas to allow unambiguous detection of empty regions
At least one region in the image is clearly devoid of the target object
[optional] Empty regions are partially occluded or near image boundaries, increasing difficulty
[optional] Objects visually blend with background or distractor elements
[optional] Object distribution is uneven, clustered, or sparse, making absence reasoning more challenging
[optional] Small or partially visible objects in a region require approximate absence judgment
[optional] Multiple object categories are present, requiring the model to reason about the absence of a specific category

failure_reasons.failure_name: Over-Sensitivity to Occlusion or Partial Visibility
failure_reasons.description: The model fails to correctly recognize or reason about objects that are partially occluded or only partially visible. Errors may occur when valid objects are ignored, misidentified, or the model refuses to generate a correct response due to incomplete object visibility.
suggested_filtering_factors: Image contains at least one visually salient object category suitable for target reasoning
Potential target objects are partially visible but retain sufficient visual cues for recognition
Most other objects in the image are largely complete and not heavily occluded, providing contextual cues
Potential target object is sufficiently recognizable despite partial occlusion
[optional] Target object is heavily occluded or only a small portion is visible
[optional] Multiple partially occluded objects appear simultaneously, increasing ambiguity
[optional] Object shape, color, or texture is partially hidden, requiring inference from visible parts
[optional] Background or distractor elements visually interfere with partially visible objects
[optional] Objects appear in unusual poses, rotations, or at image edges, increasing recognition difficulty

failure_reasons.description: The model's reasoning degrades under blur, low light, noise, or reflections.
suggested_filtering_factors: challenging visual conditions (low light, blur, reflections)
image is not severely abstract, noisy, or visually degraded
target object is partially occluded or visually blurred

failure_reasons.description: The model confuses left and right regions in coarse spatial localization tasks (loc_coarse_region).
suggested_filtering_factors: objects have clearly distinguishable spatial positions and relationships
at least one such object has visually identifiable boundaries or distinguishable parts
directional discrimination

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to distinguish between foreground and background objects in spatial localization (loc_coarse_region).
suggested_filtering_factors: foreground-background distinction
objects are contextually consistent with background environment
empty or background-only regions do not exceed approximately one-third of image

failure_reasons.description: The model has difficulty determining whether an object is in the center region or near the boundary between regions (loc_coarse_region).
suggested_filtering_factors: objects have clearly distinguishable spatial positions and relationships
at least one such object can be treated as single coherent entity for localization
potential target object boundaries are visually discernible

failure_reasons.description: The model incorrectly determines quadrant boundaries or misassigns objects near quadrant boundaries (loc_quadrant).
suggested_filtering_factors: objects have clearly distinguishable spatial positions and relationships
when partitioned into predefined spatial regions, potential target objects are present in at least two regions
potential target object boundaries are visually discernible

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to meaningfully partition the image into quadrants when objects span multiple quadrants (loc_quadrant).
suggested_filtering_factors: objects have clearly distinguishable spatial positions and relationships
when partitioned into predefined spatial regions, potential target objects are present in at least two regions
at least one such object can be treated as single coherent entity for localization

failure_reasons.description: The model confuses objects at the center of the image with quadrant boundaries (loc_quadrant).
suggested_filtering_factors: objects have clearly distinguishable spatial positions and relationships
potential target object boundaries are visually discernible
at least one such object can be treated as single coherent entity for localization

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to correctly identify or distinguish the reference object in relative spatial reasoning (loc_relative_object).
suggested_filtering_factors: multiple objects of different semantic types
at least one visually salient object
visually similar distractor objects
potential target object category is unambiguous and conceptually clear

failure_reasons.description: The model confuses relative spatial directions such as left/right, above/below, in front of/behind (loc_relative_object).
suggested_filtering_factors: objects have clearly distinguishable spatial positions and relationships
multiple objects of different semantic types
directional discrimination
orientation judgment requires fine-grained directional discrimination

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to reason about spatial relationships when multiple objects are present (loc_relative_object).
suggested_filtering_factors: multiple objects of different semantic types
objects have clearly distinguishable spatial positions and relationships
interacting or overlapping objects requiring disambiguation

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to detect or localize objects near image edges or boundaries (loc_edge_region).
suggested_filtering_factors: at least one visually salient object
potential target object appears in challenging regions (shadows, background, corners, or partial occlusion)
at least one such object has visually identifiable boundaries or distinguishable parts

failure_reasons.description: The model has difficulty determining whether an object is in a corner region or near a corner (loc_edge_region).
suggested_filtering_factors: potential target object appears in challenging regions (shadows, background, corners, or partial occlusion)
potential target object boundaries are visually discernible
at least one such object can be treated as single coherent entity for localization

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to recognize or localize objects that are partially outside the frame (loc_edge_region).
suggested_filtering_factors: target object is partially visible
potential target object is partially visible
at least one such object has visually identifiable boundaries or distinguishable parts

failure_reasons.description: The model overlooks objects near edges due to reduced saliency or attention bias toward center regions (loc_edge_region).
suggested_filtering_factors: at least one visually salient object
visually salient object category
potential target object appears in challenging regions (shadows, background, corners, or partial occlusion)

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to detect small objects that occupy a relatively small portion of the image (loc_small_object).
suggested_filtering_factors: potential target object occupies relatively small region of image
potential target object occupies small or partial region
at least one visually salient object
target object occupies small portion of image

failure_reasons.description: The model detects a small object but fails to accurately localize it to the correct region (loc_small_object).
suggested_filtering_factors: potential target object occupies relatively small region of image
potential target object boundaries are visually discernible
at least one such object can be treated as single coherent entity for localization

failure_reasons.description: The model returns NOT_RELATED too frequently for small objects due to uncertainty, even when localization is possible (loc_small_object).
suggested_filtering_factors: potential target object occupies relatively small region of image
potential target object is complete or sufficiently recognizable
potential target object category is unambiguous and conceptually clear

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to localize partially occluded objects even when sufficient visual evidence exists (loc_occluded_object).
suggested_filtering_factors: target object is partially visible
potential target object is partially visible
target object is partially occluded or visually blurred
potential target object is complete or sufficiently recognizable

failure_reasons.description: The model rejects localization attempts for partially visible objects, over-relying on full object visibility (loc_occluded_object).
suggested_filtering_factors: target object is partially visible
potential target object is partially visible
most objects are largely complete and not heavily occluded
potential target object is complete or sufficiently recognizable

failure_reasons.description: The model incorrectly assesses whether partial visual evidence is sufficient for localization (loc_occluded_object).
suggested_filtering_factors: target object is partially visible
potential target object is partially visible
potential target object is complete or sufficiently recognizable
at least one such object has visually identifiable boundaries or distinguishable parts

failure_reasons.description: The model avoids making absence judgments for specific regions, preferring uncertain responses (loc_absence_region).
suggested_filtering_factors: when partitioned into predefined spatial regions, potential target objects are present in at least two regions
at most two spatial regions may be completely absent of potential target objects
at least one visually salient object category

failure_reasons.description: The model incorrectly classifies uncertain cases as FALSE instead of NOT_RELATED, or vice versa (loc_absence_region).
suggested_filtering_factors: when partitioned into predefined spatial regions, potential target objects are present in at least two regions
at most two spatial regions may be completely absent of potential target objects
potential target object category is unambiguous and conceptually clear

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to reason about object absence within specific quadrants or regions (loc_absence_region).
suggested_filtering_factors: when partitioned into predefined spatial regions, potential target objects are present in at least two regions
at most two spatial regions may be completely absent of potential target objects
at least one type of potential target objects has visually clear and contiguous boundaries

failure_reasons.description: The model overuses NOT_RELATED responses when objects exist but naming or identification is challenging (loc_any_object_region).
suggested_filtering_factors: at least one visually salient object
visually salient object category
potential target object category is unambiguous and conceptually clear

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to ground spatial concepts even when localizable objects are present (loc_any_object_region).
suggested_filtering_factors: objects have clearly distinguishable spatial positions and relationships
at least one such object can be treated as single coherent entity for localization
at least one visually salient object

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to localize any object in the specified region when objects are clearly present (loc_any_object_region).
suggested_filtering_factors: at least one visually salient object
at least one such object has visually identifiable boundaries or distinguishable parts
at least one such object can be treated as single coherent entity for localization

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to ground concepts conveyed by the image to matchable terms in question answering tasks.
suggested_filtering_factors: clear and identifiable concept
concept intrinsic to depicted content
concept can be inferred from image content without external textual context
multiple objects present but collectively support same underlying concept
concept requires non-trivial semantic inference

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to generate or select accurate scene descriptions or captions.
suggested_filtering_factors: image depicts real-world photographic scene
multiple objects of different semantic types
objects have clearly distinguishable spatial positions and relationships
objects are contextually consistent with background environment
most objects are largely complete and not heavily occluded

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to identify geographic locations from map representations.
suggested_filtering_factors: real-world, non-fictional geographic location represented in map form
visually salient and deliberately highlighted region
highlighted region is perceptually distinct from surrounding map context
sufficient geographic cues (shape of highlighted region and surrounding spatial context)
identifying location requires external geographic knowledge
map contains minimal textual labels or place names

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to associate image content with appropriate textual descriptions.
suggested_filtering_factors: visually perceivable content that can be reasonably described in natural language
one or more objects, scenes, or activities are present
image does not rely on extensive external context
loosely identifiable main subject or scene
generally consistent description across different viewers

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to accurately estimate the proportion of image occupied by target objects.
suggested_filtering_factors: at least one visually salient object category
potential target object is complete or sufficiently recognizable
image is not overwhelmingly dominated by single potential target object
potential target object boundaries are visually discernible
potential target object category is unambiguous and conceptually clear
multiple instances of potential target object or complex arrangements

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to determine the facing direction of directional objects.
suggested_filtering_factors: at least one visually salient object
potential target object belongs to category that is inherently directional
target object occupies small portion of image
target object is partially occluded or visually blurred
orientation judgment requires fine-grained directional discrimination

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to count objects as discrete instances, especially when objects overlap or are partially visible.
suggested_filtering_factors: at least one visually identifiable object category that can be counted
target objects are countable as discrete instances
target objects are partially visible or truncated
target objects overlap or occlude each other
multiple visually similar object subtypes may need to be jointly counted

failure_reasons.description: The model confuses target objects with visually similar distractors or background elements.
suggested_filtering_factors: visually similar distractor objects
target objects visually blend with background colors or textures
target object category is unambiguous and conceptually clear

failure_reasons.description: The model incorrectly counts reflections or mirror images as separate object instances.
suggested_filtering_factors: mirrors or reflections introduce duplicated or misleading object appearances
target objects are countable as discrete instances

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to meet requirements for object absence reasoning when target objects lack clear boundaries.
suggested_filtering_factors: at least one type of potential target objects has visually clear and contiguous boundaries
potential target objects occupy sufficiently large and contiguous area
at least one visually salient object category

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to correctly reason about object absence when target objects are not distributed across required regions.
suggested_filtering_factors: when partitioned into predefined spatial regions, potential target objects are present in at least two regions
at most two spatial regions may be completely absent of potential target objects
potential target objects occupy sufficiently large and contiguous area

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to localize objects in challenging regions such as shadows, background, corners, or partial occlusion.
suggested_filtering_factors: potential target object appears in challenging regions (shadows, background, corners, or partial occlusion)
at least one such object has visually identifiable boundaries or distinguishable parts
at least one such object can be treated as single coherent entity for localization

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to localize target objects when visually similar distractors are present.
suggested_filtering_factors: visually similar distractor objects
potential target object category is unambiguous and conceptually clear
at least one visually salient object

failure_reasons.description: The model's performance degrades under challenging visual conditions such as low light, blur, or reflections.
suggested_filtering_factors: challenging visual conditions (low light, blur, reflections)
image is not severely abstract, noisy, or visually degraded
target object is partially occluded or visually blurred

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to handle variations in object appearance due to packaging, surface decoration, or deformation.
suggested_filtering_factors: object appearance varies due to packaging, surface decoration, or deformation
target object category is unambiguous and conceptually clear

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to handle objects appearing under unusual poses, rotations, or viewpoints.
suggested_filtering_factors: target objects appear under unusual poses, rotations, or viewpoints
potential target object is complete or sufficiently recognizable

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to correctly identify when zero instances of the target object are present.
suggested_filtering_factors: image contains zero instances of target object
at least one visually identifiable object category that can be counted

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to handle abstract, relational, or attribute-based concepts rather than concrete object labels.
suggested_filtering_factors: abstract, relational, or attribute-based concept rather than concrete object label
concept requires non-trivial semantic inference
clear and identifiable concept

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to handle maps with geometric or scale distortion that increases difficulty.
suggested_filtering_factors: map may exhibit mild geometric or scale distortion that increases difficulty without obscuring essential geographic structure
sufficient geographic cues (shape of highlighted region and surrounding spatial context)
